Posts.EditableText: I was wondering if you could add a suffix or prefix option for the directions so that we could add our own little details. For example, if I add the suffix "to the Backyard." for north, it could possibly result to: You can go north to the Backyard. Or adding the prefix "to the living room in the" for southwest, which would then result to "You can go to the living room in the southwest." Thanks! This would mean a lot to me!
Posts.HTML:
I was wondering if you could add a suffix or prefix option for the directions so that we could add our own little details.

For example, if I add the suffix "to the Backyard." for north, it could possibly result to:

You can go north to the Backyard.

Or adding the prefix "to the living room in the" for southwest, which would then result to "You can go to the living room in the southwest."

Thanks! This would mean a lot to me!

Posts.EditableText: You can do this already. If you click the exit in the tree, you can type in a prefix. The suffix is not listed in the editor, but if you go to the Attributes tab, you can add "suffix" as a string attribute there and it will work. I'll add this to the editor in the next release - http://quest.codeplex.com/workitem/986
